text: Louis Isadore Kahn (born Itze-Leib Schmuilowsky) ( â€“ March 17, 1974) was an Estonian-born American architect. His career was set in Philadelphia. He founded his own atelier in 1935. While continuing his private practice, he was a design critic and professor of architecture at Yale School of Architecture from 1947 to 1957. From 1957 until his death, he was a professor of architecture at the School of Design at the University of Pennsylvania. Kahn died of a heart attack on March 17, 1974 in a bathroom at Penn Station in Manhattan, aged 73. ==References== Category:1901 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American architects Category:Educators from Philadelphia Category:American critics Category:Writers from Philadelphia Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction
